Class StaffReportPage

java.lang.Object
application.StaffReportPage
public class StaffReportPage extends Object

The StaffReportPage class provides comprehensive reporting and analytics functionality for staff members to monitor system health and user activity.

This page implements User Story 3: "As a staff member, I want to summarize trends or issues from interactions, so that I can provide feedback to instructors and other staff."

The page displays:

  • Content statistics (counts of questions, answers, reviews, messages)
  • Issue indicators (unresolved questions, pending flags)
  • User activity metrics (user counts by role, most active users)
  • Automated analysis and recommendations based on current trends
  • Exportable report generation for sharing with instructors

The analysis section automatically identifies potential issues such as:

  • High percentage of unresolved questions
  • Excessive pending flags requiring attention
  • Low answer-to-question ratios
  • Poor user engagement rates

  • Constructor Details

    • StaffReportPage

      public StaffReportPage(DatabaseHelper databaseHelper, User currentUser)
      Constructs a new StaffReportPage.
      Parameters:
      databaseHelper - the database helper for statistics access
      currentUser - the currently logged-in staff user

  • Method Details

    • show

      public void show(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Displays the staff report page in the provided stage. Creates a scrollable view with statistics, trends, and analysis sections.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the stage to display the report page

    • createStatisticsSection

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox createStatisticsSection()
      Creates the statistics section showing system-wide content counts and metrics. Includes total counts for questions, answers, reviews, messages, and user statistics. Highlights issues such as unresolved questions and pending flags.
      Returns:
      a VBox containing the statistics section

    • createTrendsSection

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox createTrendsSection()
      Creates the trends section showing user activity and automated analysis. Displays the most active users and provides intelligent recommendations based on current system health metrics.
      Returns:
      a VBox containing the trends and analysis section

    • addStatRow

      private void addStatRow(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, int row, String label, String value)
      Adds a single statistic row to the statistics grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - the GridPane to add the row to
      row - the row index
      label - the label text for the statistic
      value - the value to display

    • addStatRow

      private void addStatRow(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, int row, String label, String value, boolean highlight)
      Adds a single statistic row to the statistics grid with optional highlighting. Highlighted rows are displayed in red to draw attention to potential issues.
      Parameters:
      grid - the GridPane to add the row to
      row - the row index
      label - the label text for the statistic
      value - the value to display
      highlight - whether to highlight this statistic (true for issues/warnings)

    • exportReport

      private void exportReport()
      Generates and displays an exportable text report with all statistics and analysis. The report can be copied and shared with instructors or other staff members. Includes timestamp, content statistics, and top active users.
